channel.title: Survival Horror
channel.description: I'm running out of ideas for games to play; anybody know any good, bat-shit scary, horror games? (any type of horror as long as it's scary)

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: Dr_Strangelove
item.description:
Close your eyes and shake a bat in a cage, it’s the same experience.

Also, SoaringScout is bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: SoaringScout
item.description:
Doom 3 scared me a bit. Probably because I was expecting something that would make me shit myself, but I overestimated the game and got scared at the zombies. When I think of it, it’s barely scary.

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: Chrillen
item.description:
Android11x:

The fast zombies and their ability to reach seemingly unreachable places is what makes that level.

I think I was 12 when I first played Ravenholm, I nearly shat myself when I saw the first fast zombie up on that roof, howling.

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: AI13
item.description:
Flame me all you want but I still think the level “The Flood” from Halo 1 (imho the only good Halo) was the my scariest experience in gaming ever. The music, cutscenes, and general build up to the flood scared the crap out of me, that said, that was the only scary part of the game for me. Aside from that, well, Deadspace is not scary, an amazing game that almost perfectly pulls of the genre, but not scary, the plasma cutter is just too powerful for your first weapon. The Resident Evil Series is just annoying, as some one else posted, the only fear is that you are going to run out of ammo. The F.E.A.R series incorporates survival in only the most basic sense, however the second game does a pretty good job of instilling at least worry into the player. The first one just felt like Half Life 1 with better graphics and shock horror.

Read full topic

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
I remember the mod “Mistake-1” for Half-Life as being pretty scary:
https://www.moddb.com/mods/mistake-1

It’s a mod, though, so it’s not going to be very long. I also wouldn’t consider it to be a “survival horror”, just a physiological horror.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: awsgames
item.description:
Aze:

For example you lack of ammunition in most parts of the game and your melee attack is kindof useless. Specially at the beggining.

That’s not scary. That’s just annoying.

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
Ibanez:

oh yeah, call of cthulhu is fucking awesome. first game that gave me shivers. play it at night, it totally mindfucks you.

yeah, it’s easily one of the most disturbing games ever without shoving it down your throat, the atmopshere and characters creep the hell out of me to the point i just had to stop playing.

If you want creepy, play it.

Read full topic

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: Aze
item.description:
I liked Resident evil 5, sure it’s not horror, rather action game, but it has some survivor game features. For example you lack of ammunition in most parts of the game and your melee attack is kindof useless. Specially at the beggining.

Read full topic

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: Duck
item.description:
awsgames:

Silent Hill 2.

indeed I remember playing it my first time, and I shit myself, When I cam across the First Demon, Even after that, I still could’nt Approach any with out having a heart attack.

Silent Hill 3 & Silent Hill: Homecoming, are good.

Read full topic

item.title: Survival Horror
item.dc:creator: Shasta
item.description:
Imonfire:

F.E.A.R.s, Doom 3 and REs[/SIZE] aren’t survival horrors. They’re shooters with horror elements, but there’s no “survival” elements in them.

Errr…go play Resident Evil 1, 2 and 3. They basically helped CREATE the survival horror genre, and are almost identical in general gameplay structure as Silent Hill 1, 2 and 3.

Read full topic
